result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael J Lexa was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Lexa in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.   The defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #2:

HUBER:  90 days, w/Standard Release Conditions (Credit -50 Days) to begin forthwith.

FINE: $1179.00(apply cash bail and balance to be paid as a condition of probation on 14CF1414 & 15CF1233)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00,(to be paid as a condition of probation on 14CF1414 & 15CF1233)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00  paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department (to be paid as a condition of probation on 14CF1414 & 15CF1233)

D/L REVOCATION: 17 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 17 months;

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  11/18/15. Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 10:00 am

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
